; Hu Jinglin, the new Party Secretary of the State Administration of Taxation. Picture source: The official website of the Ministry of Finance

;

;The official website of the State Administration of Taxation announced that on the morning of November 28, 2023, relevant responsible comrades from the Organization Department of the Central Committee attended the meeting of leading cadres of the State Administration of Taxation and announced the central government’s decision: Comrade Hu Jinglin will be appointed as the national Secretary of the Party Committee of the State Administration of Taxation, Comrade Wang Jun is removed from his position as Secretary of the Party Committee of the State Administration of Taxation.

;

;Before taking over as Secretary of the Party Committee of the State Administration of Taxation, Hu Jinglin was Secretary of the Party Committee and Director of the National Medical Security Administration.

;

;Served in the Ministry of Finance for 20 years

;

;According to the official website of the State Council Information Office, Hu Jinglin was born in 1964 in Shexian County, Anhui Province. He graduated from Renmin University of China and received a doctorate in economics.

;

;Since 1992, Hu Jinglin has worked in the State-owned Assets Administration Bureau as deputy director of the Policy, Regulations and Judicial Regulations Division. According to the "Historical Dictionary Series of the Communist Party of China", in order to straighten out the relationship between state-owned assets and establish and improve the state-owned assets management system in the process of reform and opening up, in November 1988, the state established the State-owned Assets Administration Bureau.

;

;According to information from the Chinese Government website, in 1994, the State-owned Assets Administration became a national bureau (deputy ministerial level) managed by the Ministry of Finance. Its main task is to comprehensively manage state-owned assets within and outside the People's Republic of China.

;

;In March 1998, the State-owned Assets Administration Bureau was officially abolished. In the same year, the Large Enterprise Working Committee of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China was formally established. During this period, the management structure of state-owned enterprises changed several times until the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council was established in 2003.

;

;At the time of organizational reform in 1998, Hu Jinglin entered the Property Appraisal Department of the Ministry of Finance, and then served as Director of the Economic Construction Department of the Ministry of Finance, Director of the General Office of the Ministry of Finance, and Spokesperson of the Ministry of Finance.

;

; According to the official website of the State Council Information Office, Hu Jinglin has long been engaged in state-owned enterprise reform and macroeconomic theoretical research and practical work. He has rich work experience and profound theoretical foundation. He has participated in a number of major reforms of financial and industrial management systems and He is engaged in research on important macroeconomic policies and has authored (translated) many works such as "State-owned Enterprise Reform and Approaches", "Financial Asset Assessment", and "U.S. Federal Government Budget".

;

;In 2009, Hu Jinglin served as Assistant Minister of Finance and member of the Party Leadership Group. Five years later, he was promoted to deputy minister of finance.

;

;According to The Paper, when he was promoted to Vice Minister of Finance, Hu Jinglin was in charge of the General Office, Department of Agriculture, National Agricultural Comprehensive Development Office, Bureau of Retired Cadres, Information Network Center, and China Finance and Taxation Museum, assisting then Minister of Finance Lou Jiwei is in charge of the Office of the State Council’s Comprehensive Rural Reform Working Group.

;

;During his tenure at the Ministry of Finance, Hu Jinglin repeatedly emphasized the importance of budget management.

;

;In 2015, Hu Jinglin emphasized at the National Financial, Administrative, Political and Legal Work Conference that as far as the budget is concerned, it is necessary to enhance the legality and binding force of the budget and how to solve the problems of inaccurate budget preparation at the beginning of the year and mid-year budget. To deal with the problems of frequent adjustments and excessive budget balances at the end of the year, "we need to work with departments to establish the concept of 'budget is law'."

;

;"Never let the medical insurance fund become 'Tang Monk Meat'"

;

;After four years as Deputy Minister of Finance, Hu Jinglin was transferred to the National Medical Security Administration.

;

;In March 2018, the First Session of the 13th National People's Congress voted to adopt a decision on the institutional reform plan of the State Council, establishing the National Medical Security Administration of the People's Republic of China (deputy ministerial level) and becoming an agency directly under the State Council. Hu Jinglin became the first director.

;

;The institutional reform plan of the State Council at that time proposed that the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security’s basic medical insurance and maternity insurance responsibilities for urban employees and urban residents, the National Health and Family Planning Commission’s new rural cooperative medical responsibilities, and the national The National Development and Reform Commission's drug and medical service price management responsibilities and the Ministry of Civil Affairs' medical assistance responsibilities were integrated to form the National Medical Security Administration.

;

;In the past few years, during his tenure, Hu Jinglin actively promoted the solution of problems such as difficulty and high cost of medication for ordinary people.

;

;In March 2019, during the National Two Sessions, Hu Jinglin said in an interview at the "Ministerial Channel" that more life-saving and emergency medicines should be included in medical insurance by optimizing the directory structure to further alleviate and alleviate the epidemic. It is difficult for the people to use medicine and it is expensive.

;

;At the State Council Information Office press conference in May 2023, Hu Jinglin introduced that in the past five years, the National Medical Insurance Administration has accelerated the pace of medical insurance negotiations and promoted a large number of exclusive drugs such as camrelizumab and nosinaxin sodium. A variety of anti-cancer drugs and drugs for rare diseases are included in medical insurance at appropriate prices, and after reimbursement, the cumulative burden on patients has been reduced by more than 500 billion yuan.

;

;In 2019, the official website of the National Medical Insurance Administration published an article written by Hu Jinglin, stating that the next step is to strengthen the management of medical insurance funds, continue to carry out in-depth special operations against fraudulent insurance, and "look back" on some provinces Conduct random inspections and reviews of work. In addition, give full play to the power of the reporting reward system and establish a reporting clue supervision and feedback mechanism.

;

;"Make good use of the agreement management system. Medical institutions whose agreements have been terminated shall not be included in the medical insurance designated areas within 3 years. Build a long-term mechanism for fund supervision and ;;;Never let the medical insurance fund Become the new 'Tang Monk Meat';." Hu Jinglin introduced.

;

;At the above-mentioned press conference of the State Council Information Office, Hu Jinglin said that medical insurance funds are "life-saving money" for the people. The National Medical Insurance Administration has always regarded strengthening the supervision of medical insurance funds and maintaining fund security as its top priority, and severely cracked down on various forms of fraud. Such illegal use of medical insurance funds.

;

;"In the past five years, the total annual revenue of the basic medical insurance fund (including maternity insurance) has increased from 2.14 trillion yuan to 3.09 trillion yuan, and the total annual expenditure has increased from 1.78 trillion yuan to 2.46 trillion yuan. The fund is running smoothly and has a balance," Hu Jinglin said.

;

;Wang Jun has been the director of the State Administration of Taxation for ten years

;

;The Chinese government website shows that Wang Jun, the current director of the State Administration of Taxation, was born in 1958. He graduated from Peking University and received a doctorate in law.

;

;Wang Jun served in the Ministry of Finance from 1987 to 2013. In March 2013, Wang Jun, then deputy secretary of the Party Leadership Group and deputy minister of the Ministry of Finance, was promoted to secretary of the Party Leadership Group and director of the State Administration of Taxation.

;

;;

;

;In 2023, Wang Jun, Director of the State Administration of Taxation, and The head of Qatar’s General Tax Authority held talks. Image source: The official website of the State Administration of Taxation

;

;At the end of 1993, the State Council issued a document stating that in order to adapt to the national tax work, the organizational specifications of the State Administration of Taxation would be adjusted from the deputy ministerial level to the ministerial level. In January 1994, China began to implement the reform of the fiscal and taxation system with the tax-sharing system as the core, which significantly increased the central fiscal revenue.

;

;Since the reform of the tax-sharing system, the State Administration of Taxation has successively had five directors, namely Liu Zhongli, Jin Renqing, Xie Xuren, Xiao Jie, and Wang Jun. Among them, Wang Jun has served the longest.

;

;All five of them have worked in the Ministry of Finance, and four of them have served as Ministers of Finance.

;

;Liu Zhongli served as Minister of Finance and concurrently Director of the State Administration of Taxation from 1992 to 1998. Jin Renqing, Xie Xuren, and Xiao Jie all served as Ministers of Finance after serving as Directors of the State Administration of Taxation.

;

;As of now, Wang Jun has served as the director of the State Administration of Taxation for ten years and is 65 years old. In March 2023, Wang Jun was elected as a member of the Standing Committee of the 14th National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.

;

;Looking back at the resumes of Wang Jun and Hu Jinglin, they have worked together in the Ministry of Finance for more than ten years, and both have served as director of the General Office of the Ministry of Finance, spokesperson, assistant minister, deputy minister, etc.

;

;In the ten years since Wang Jun served as director of the State Administration of Taxation, China's tax system reform has continued to deepen, including a series of actions such as replacing business tax with VAT, individual tax reform, merging state and local taxes, and tax and fee reductions.

;

;Starting from October 2018, the "threshold" for personal income tax will be increased from 3,500 yuan/month to 5,000 yuan/month.

;

;Five months later, Wang Jun said at the "Ministerial Channel" of the National Two Sessions that the personal income tax reform will bring 100% tax reduction to the working class, and about 80 million of them will no longer have to pay a tax. Taxes will be reduced by more than 70% for about 65 million people.

;

;In the same year, the First Session of the Thirteenth National People's Congress passed the institutional reform plan of the State Council. The State Council will reform the national and local tax collection and administration systems, merge the national and local tax agencies at the provincial and sub-provincial levels, and specifically bear the responsibilities of various taxation agencies within its jurisdiction. Responsibilities such as tax and non-tax revenue collection and management.

;

;The tax-sharing system reform in 1994 established two sets of tax collection and management systems: national tax and local tax. After 24 years of operation, the state and local taxes were merged and a new tax collection and administration system was established.

;

;As for the effects of tax cuts and fee reductions, the 2023 State Council Government Work Report concluded, “In the past five years, a cumulative tax reduction of 5.4 trillion yuan and a fee reduction of 2.8 trillion yuan have been achieved.”

;On November 26, 2023, the written test for public subjects of the national examination will begin. The number of applicants for the national examination exceeded 3 million for the first time. A total of 2.613 million candidates confirmed their registration before the examination, and 2.252 million actually took the examination, which is unprecedented. Vertical comparison shows that a total of 1.422 million people actually took the exam last year. From 2020 to 2024, the number of people recruited for the national examination will be approximately 24,100, 25,700, 31,200, 37,100, and 39,600, which is rising steadily, but it is far from meeting everyone's application needs.

;

;In contrast, this year is the first time in eight years that the number of people taking the postgraduate entrance examination has dropped, which may indicate that the enthusiasm for the postgraduate entrance examination has reached its peak. This shows that it is a high probability event that the public and postgraduate entrance examinations will go their separate ways. Because for most people, the purpose of taking the postgraduate entrance examination is to delay employment and postpone the employment decision for two to three years, in the hope that a graduate degree will give them a certain competitive advantage. However, on the one hand, the employment situation is becoming increasingly difficult. Today’s undergraduate degree vs. For graduate students after two or three years, the latter may not have a significant advantage in finding a job. On the other hand, the opportunity cost of obtaining a graduate degree is getting higher and higher. Changing from a master's degree to a professional master's degree means higher tuition expenses. The public examination is different. If you use the time and money to take the postgraduate entrance examination and graduate school, you can take the public examination in multiple places in a year. Until you pass the examination, the probability of "getting on board" will be higher. The two go off and on, and it is obvious that more and more people believe that taking the public examination directly is more cost-effective.

;

;Of course, the relationship between the postgraduate entrance examination and the public examination is complex. In addition to substitution, there is also a complementary relationship. For example, some people still want to take the civil service exam after taking the postgraduate entrance examination. This is because there are more civil servant positions that they can apply for with a postgraduate degree. Educational qualifications become higher and more attractive, and there is also an additional channel for selecting students to enter politics. In short, you can expand your options for public examinations.

;

;Judging from the recruitment requirements for national examination positions, the threshold for academic qualifications is constantly rising. This year’s national examination recruitment requirements are all for a college degree or above. As the number of recruits increases year after year, the number of positions that require a college degree as a starting point is decreasing year by year. This year, there are 56 positions that college students can apply for, a decrease of 106 year-on-year. At the same time, the number of positions requiring a master's degree and the planned number of people have increased significantly. According to statistics from China Youth Daily, there are 2,046 positions requiring a master's degree or above this year, an increase of 814 year-on-year; there are 24 positions requiring a doctoral degree, an increase of 14 year-on-year.

;

;How to explain this phenomenon? A common view is that the demand for highly educated talents in government agencies has increased. This actually amounts to no explanation. Are these positions really only available to those with a master's degree or above? Probably not.

;

;In the current employment environment, the attractiveness of jobs within the system has been further enhanced: there is a "establishment", decent salary, complete benefits, high social status, and stable work. As long as you don't make big principled mistakes, you will not be unemployed. The danger. Therefore, competition for these positions will continue to intensify. The ratio of the number of people admitted to the national examination to the number of people taking the examination was 1:38 last year and 1:57 this year. The ratio of popular positions is even more exaggerated. When competition intensifies, one of the main criteria for selecting talents will naturally be academic qualifications.

;

;For employers within the system, when they are recruiting someone, why not choose someone with a higher academic qualification and a better school? Based on purely objective indicators, this is equivalent to obtaining "better talents" with the same staffing and cost, and neither leaders nor the public can find fault. On the contrary, if you do not recruit people with higher academic qualifications and better schools, but recruit people with average academic qualifications, you will most likely need to explain to the public why it is not a "carrot recruitment" and the people you recruit are the most suitable for the position.

;

;Under this logic and mentality, it is not difficult to understand the following phenomena that are hotly debated by the public: Peking University’s Ph.D. in nuclear physics obtained the urban management establishment, Shanghai Jiao Tong University’s M.D. became a middle school doctor, and Harvard University’s master’s degree applied for education Non-career positions in the Overseas Study Service Center of the Ministry of Education. It is not difficult to understand why the academic qualifications threshold for recruitment within the system continues to increase: last year, we required a bachelor's degree, but we recruited several master's degrees from prestigious universities; this year, we simply require all master's degrees, and people are willing to come and don't have to spend more money, so why not?

;

;Indeed, this is very different from the recruitment logic of free competition industries. Except for the R&D departments of some leading companies, generally the company's academic qualifications are only a reference when recruiting people. The key is to see whether personal ability and character match the company's job requirements. If you have too high academic qualifications, you will have the problem of over-qualification. For the same position, undergraduates may do better than those with master's or doctorate degrees, because from the perspective of the company, everyone must receive vocational training anyway. Being young is an advantage, the mind is not yet rigid, the person has the courage to try and accept new things, and can get started quickly.

;

;Not long ago, some undergraduates complained that they could not get offers (invitations) when applying for jobs as undergraduates, but they got many offers by pretending to be high school students. The reason why high school students are required rather than "high-achieving students" is because in the eyes of the company, high school students are enough to complete the job. All they need to do is behave in a disciplined manner, follow the procedures honestly, and listen to instructions. They hope that employees can calm down and maintain stable work. ; If you are looking for undergraduates, they may think that they are overqualified and are just making do for the time being, or they may be riding a donkey looking for a horse, and they are not willing to work without peace of mind. Why bother asking for trouble because of a false reputation? After a while, the "top students" leave, and new people have to be recruited.

;

;In short, after understanding the difference in recruitment logic and mentality between the system and the free competition industry, students can decide whether they need to go to graduate school, whether to take the public examination as an undergraduate to get a job, or to go to graduate school to make themselves available. Wider choices. These are factual judgments, not value judgments.

;

;Of course, in the long run, encouraging the best students to engage in innovation, create wealth in free competition industries, and create a good institutional environment and motivation mechanism for them will naturally be a blessing to society and a country. blessing. For some time, the government has introduced many measures to stimulate the development of the private economy. Recently, eight departments have introduced "25 specific measures to support the private economy." This effort is in the right direction.

; Wed, 29 Nov 2023 14:55:04 +0800 打造中国版甲骨文：易鲸捷与贵阳银行的双向冒险http://www.infzm.com/contents/261534
;;2023-11-29 14:00:00;
;

;;

;

;Guiyang Bank Head Office Building. Zhao Jilin/Photo

;

;On the seventh floor of the head office building of Bank of Guiyang (601997.SH), there is a place where outsiders are prohibited from entering.

;

;The computer room covering an area of ​​more than 80 square meters is filled with large electronic display screens and computer terminals. All business operations and accounting processing related to deposits and loans need to be completed here. Supporting the operation of the entire set of equipment is the new core business transaction system that was just launched on November 6, 2023.

;

;In the field of banking core business transaction systems, foreign companies such as Oracle and IBM were once absolute monopolies.

;

;In October 2020, an unknown startup company suddenly broke in. Guizhou Yijingjie Information Technology Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Yijingjie), founded in 2015, won the bid for the domestic database application project of Guiyang Bank's core business system with a price of 426 million yuan.

;

;Yijingjie plays two roles, one is the supplier of database products, and the other is the general contractor of the entire project. Its purpose is to create a full-stack core transaction system for domestic banks.

;

;After its official launch, this high-profile trading system did not win praise. Instead, it pushed Yijingjie to the forefront. For a time, the Internet was flooded with comments such as "fake domestically produced products" and "shelling Oracle", and Bank of Guiyang and Yi Jingjie became the target of public criticism.

;

;"It may be very difficult for us to build a (database) nuclear weapon for daily use for the country, but we must take this risk." Li Jing, chairman of Yi Jingjie, spoke quickly He told a reporter from Southern Weekend, his voice was trembling. She looks very capable, with short hair, tattooed eyebrows, and a red coat.

;

;At the moment, the "nuclear weapons" Li Jing talks about have not yet been put into production. He Xin, general manager of the Information Technology Department of the Bank of Guiyang, revealed to Southern Weekend reporters that the current main database of the Bank of Guiyang is Oracle, and Yi Jingjie is used as a follow-up database, which is exactly the opposite of the original plan. "I invested them all at once. To be honest, the risk will be relatively high."

;

;Zhang Xuerong, Secretary of the Party Committee and Director of Guiyang Big Data Bureau, further explained to Southern Weekend reporters that due to the influence of negative public opinion on the Internet, superior supervision Out of the principle of prudent supervision, the department does not agree to the online launch of Yijingjie database for the time being. "As long as the regulatory authorities relent, it can be launched in any minute."

;

;Delayed launch

;

;The biggest doubt from the outside world is whether Yi Wingjie, which started with distributed databases, can build a more technically difficult bank core transaction system database.

;

;The databases currently used in the financial industry are still mainly centralized, but distributed is the general trend and has computing advantages under massive data and high concurrency.

;

;The branch president of a state-owned commercial bank told Southern Weekend reporters that the difficulty in developing the bank's core transaction system database lies in the large amount of data that needs to be stored for many years and ensure that the system does not go down. In addition, each bank needs to do some customized development according to the needs of customers. For example, it has to open separate interfaces with the credit reporting system and tax system of the People's Bank of China, which "has strict requirements for security."

;

;In the three years since Guiyang Bank purchased the Yijingjie database, it has not been able to go online.

;

;Yi Wingjie was originally relatively optimistic about the launch time. According to the company's internal documents, the construction goals are divided into three stages:

;

;By the end of June 2020, achieve an average success rate of 99.999%, and successfully implement the "dual database parallel" plan for Guiyang Bank's core business system in 2021. The main database uses the domestic Yijingjie database.

;

;Before the end of September 2021, the Yijingjie database for typical applications such as banking financial core, graphical front-end, process banking, and credit systems will be transformed and put online.

;

;The third phase will comprehensively plan and transform the information system of Guiyang Bank, and realize the localization transformation of the full-scenario application system by the end of July 2022.

;

;Public information can also be seen that the launch time of Yijingjie database has been delayed.

;

;In May 2021, the evaluation report of Yijingjie’s shareholder China Software (600536.SH) showed that the core transaction main database purchased by Guiyang Bank is planned to be officially launched in the first half of 2022. Apparently it didn't happen.

;

;It was already two years later, in May 2023, that there was any further news. When accepting a survey from investors, the Bank of Guiyang stated that the Yijingjie domestic database application project has entered the testing phase and is advancing various testing tasks in an orderly manner. .

;

;On November 2, another investor asked about the progress of Yijingjie’s domestic database at the Bank of Guiyang’s third quarter performance briefing. Chairman Zhang Zhenghai replied, “The development of the new core business system of Bank of Guiyang has been completed. Testing work, the system has entered the online preparation stage, and the system is expected to be online from 17:00 on November 3, 2023 to 8:00 on November 6."

;

;Until November 6, Guiyang Bank issued an announcement stating that "the new system has been successfully launched", but did not declare what database it adopted.

;

; Regarding the current status of Yijingjie as a backup follower library, He Xin explained that for relatively mature bank core trading systems, it usually takes 18-24 months from research and development to launch. However, the Guiyang Bank project has many innovations, such as the full-stack core business system and the first application of eCas4.0 in the banking industry, so it takes a long time.

;

;He also added that as early as the beginning of 2021, Guiyang Bank signed a contract with Oracle to allow Oracle and Yijingjie to run parallel databases to back up each other, creating a relatively safe structure. The performance of Yijingjie database is acceptable, but the database does not only rely on performance. "If it is actually put online, we would like to test it more."

;

;;

;

;Yijingjie is located on the 24th floor of Tower C, No. 1, Gaoke. Zhao Jilin/Picture

;

;“No city dares to do this”

;

;On the top of Building C, No. 1 Gaoke, Changling South Road, High-tech Zone, Guiyang City, the big words “Big Data National Engineering Laboratory” are very Eye-catching, Yi Wingjie is located on the 24th floor of the building.

;

;In addition to Yijingjie, Internet companies such as NetEase Haowu and Qilin Software have settled here.

;

;The development of big data in Guizhou Province started in 2012. The development of the big data industry is considered by Guizhou as an excellent opportunity to change lanes and overtake. In 2015, the country established the country's first comprehensive big data pilot zone in Guizhou. One of its important tasks is to solve the security and independent controllability issues of China's big data.

;

;For Yi Jingjie, he has never had access to the core transaction system database of a bank before, so he faces great technical challenges. Similarly, for the Guiyang Municipal Government and Guiyang Bank, betting on Yijingjie is also a risk.

;

;A Guiyang State-owned Assets Representative who participated in the investment in Yijingjie revealed to Southern Weekend reporters that at the end of 2015, Guiyang State-owned Assets learned about Yijingjie and visited Yijingjie’s technical team, launching a long-term Half a year of due diligence, interviews included Tencent Music (NYSE: TME), the three major telecom operators, etc.

;

;Before investing in Yijingjie, Yijingjie signed an agreement with Guiyang State-owned Assets, stipulating that Guizhou Yijingjie would be the headquarters, and Shanghai Yijingjie and American Yijingjie would be the subsidiaries of Guizhou Yijingjie. "When we invested, we promised to invest 20 million yuan first."

;

;A person familiar with the Guiyang government revealed to a Southern Weekend reporter that although Yi Jingjie is not well-known, it does distributed databases , the leaders at the time also saw it, the technology was relatively new. "The problem with it is that no one uses it, and there is no actual application scenario verification."

;

;Zhang Xuerong said frankly that Guiyang's big data started slowly, but it can attract a database company and regard it as a treasure, or even treat it as a treasure. Unicorns to breed. "No city in the country dares to do this. We take real application scenarios and let them verify the database."

;

;2016-2019, Guiyang Industrial and Information Industry Development Guidance Fund Co., Ltd. , Guiyang Service Outsourcing and Call Industry Venture Capital Fund Co., Ltd., Guizhou Provincial Venture Investment Promotion Center, Guiyang Comprehensive Bonded Zone Development Investment (Group) Co., Ltd., Gui'an New Area Emerging Industry Development Fund (Co., Ltd.) and other state-owned industrial funds , successively became shareholders of Yijingjie by increasing capital, with a cumulative investment of 128 million yuan.

;

;Many people from the Guiyang Municipal Government told Southern Weekend reporters that the initial investment and introduction of Yijingjie was based on its overseas technology. According to the official website of Yijingjie, the company is "one of the few domestic database manufacturers with independent core technology." The R&D team originates from Tianteng Company, with 30 years of technology accumulation and a complete team structure.

;

;Yijingjie was initially chaired by Chinese-American Li Weichong, and Li Jing, as his Chinese wife, served as the legal representative. Li Weichong has a glorious resume. He graduated from Carnegie Mellon University and received dual doctorates in finance and computer chemistry. ; This investment amount is far from the original plan that "the total contribution does not exceed 389 million yuan, and the total holding of a total of not exceeding the 25%equity of the Yibbles" is far away.

;

;When my parents got married in Nanjing, the capital of the Republic of China, in May 1933, my grandmother invited some Chinese ladies who she thought were not decent. Come and stand with the bride during the ceremony. This is because grandma was shocked when she saw the 20-year-old German girl chosen by her doting third son: brown loose hair, thin and long face, eyes that fell into her head, and was squashed The raised nose is so ugly and perverted! How could this happen? Grandma was frantic, trying desperately to find some uglier ladies to reconcile the horrific situation.

;

;;

;

;1933 Xu Daolin and Barbara Schuchard held their wedding in Nanjing, and Jiang Fucong was the witness. Information map

;

;The introducer at that time was Mr. Jiang Fuchong, my father’s senior student in Germany, who was cheerful and progressive. Mr. Jiang later became the director of the National Central Library. There are many advanced and effective management measures, and it is advocated that all books should be digitized and permanently preserved for the public. Later, Uncle Chiang became the first director of the National Palace Museum in Taipei, where he implemented many new initiatives. Out of consideration for the benefit of employees, he provided dormitories and welfare facilities for everyone near the museum, which was still a suburb at the time. Wait for facilities. In 1933, he served as a witness at his parents' wedding ceremony in Nanjing. He later told me that he "ate the little tiger's red egg."

;

;My mother took a boat from Germany, which fell to Nazism, to China to marry Xu Daolin. She found that this ancient country had many traditions that were very difficult for her. At first she refused to kneel and kowtow in front of her grandma like her father did. Growing up in Berlin, Barbara Schuchard had never kowtowed to anyone or any god in her life. In front of many curious viewers, her spine became an unbendable iron bar. At first, the poor father could only run back and forth between mother and wife to explain, and became a master of "diplomacy".

;

;The next spring, a huge typhoon hit Nanjing. The young bride went to the Central Hospital to give birth to their first child, and found that the windows of the hospital ward were also covered with debris. Broken by the typhoon. She thought excitedly, ah! This must be a "presidential-level" boy! The father is also waiting for his son, and they have prepared many names - all for boys. When they saw a red and wrinkled little girl, they were completely stunned, indescribable surprise and disappointment. They looked at each other, not knowing what to do. One day passed, two days passed, and I couldn't think of any girl's name.

;

;On the third day, grandma spoke. She explained to the new parents the ins and outs of the baby. Feng Conghu and Yun Conglong, this descendant is obviously my father's favorite big cat named Xiaohu when he was a child. The cat was suddenly run over by a car one day. The "three bald boys" of the Xu family (my grandfather shaved the heads of all his sons and refused to wear Manchu pigtails) were so sad that they didn't eat or sleep. They just felt sad. . Grandma comforted Dad and said, don't cry, Santuer, your little tiger will fly back to you as soon as possible and stay with you for the rest of his life. Dad felt relieved and slowly returned to normal.

;

;Grandma hugged the new little girl and said: Look, isn't this the little tiger you have been waiting for so many years to come back to accompany you? Who did you say? This is the little tiger who came back. My parents had nothing to say, so my grandma looked at my mother’s face and gave her daughter-in-law a title for the first time——;You say Isn't it, Hu Zi Niang? ;

;

;;

;

;In the summer of 1934, Xu Little Tiger and his parents in Guling, Lushan Mountain. Data map

;

;Eight years later, we spent the most beautiful time in Geleshan, the suburb of Chongqing, the capital of Chongqing, where azaleas bloomed all over the hills and pine trees danced in the wind. time. From 1938 to 1941, my father served as the Charge d’Affaires of the Republic of China in Italy for four years. When World War II broke out and China and Italy broke off diplomatic relations, my parents took my sister Xiaoyu and me back to China. Grandma also came to Geleshan from her aunt's house in Chengdu to welcome her third son after four years of separation.

;

;Our plane landed in Chongqing, and the welcome crowd gathered next to our parents, speaking adult Chinese. I walked down the gangway and stepped onto the land of China. I was extremely moved. This is my motherland! My eight-year-old heart nearly burst. My elementary school classmates in Rome once asked me, Uncle! (This is the pronunciation of Xu Xiaohu by foreigners)

;

;;Uncle Stop shouting! Why is your face so flat? ;

;

;I thought about it and answered: This is because I come from a very far away and very ancient country. The Chinese Embassy you saw on Viale Pola has strong guards in front of it wearing beautiful uniforms and tall feathered helmets. That is my ancient and luxurious motherland.

;

;Now I kneel on the land of my motherland, bend down and lower my head, passionately kiss the place I have dreamed of for four years, I am happy and moved, and shed tears. Tell the motherland softly, great land, the tiger cub is back, your child is back. I will learn Chinese as soon as possible and become a Chinese.

;

;The land at that time was so dirty, not as bright and clean as Rome. I saw dirty children with tattered clothes and scabs on their heads, standing there with bare feet and a runny nose, staring at us. Like adults, they spit out phlegm from their mouths and spit it on the ground. Xiaohu was very sad when he returned to China, but he insisted on thinking that this is my favorite motherland, that far, far away, very ancient motherland.

;

;After several hours of climbing up the hillside in a sedan chair, we finally arrived at the small, dark mud house at No. 15, Bakuaitian, Geleshan. Someone was carrying the luggage in, and my mother and sister went into the house and rummaged through the luggage for something. I stayed on the balcony and watched my father kneel down next to my grandmother who had her head and feet bound. Mother and son hugged each other, and grandma burst into tears, her thin and high-pitched voice reaching to the sky. Dad cried silently, and they held him and cried like this for a long time. I felt sad after reading it. I didn’t understand a word, but I fully understood the emotion in their hearts. I left quietly, walked into the door, climbed on a chair next to the big round table, and saw a pot of tea and a few unattended cups on the table. Don’t know what that drink is, but it must be a drink from my home country. I just poured myself a drink and watched.

;

;Bitter. Adult taste. taste of China. I love it, I want to love it. Have another drink and taste it. Another glass. I have never tasted this taste in my life. A flavor not found in Italy. I am Chinese and I can drink Chinese taste. Cup after cup, I took in this ancient flavor with love and breathed it into my soul. Xu Xiaohu and her motherland gradually became one.

;

;It is starting to get dark. The crying and complaining outside hasn't stopped yet, but it's hard to see clearly inside the house. Someone placed a lamp on the big table. It was a green long-handled oil lamp made of ceramics. There was a white wick floating on the bowl of oil, and it was burning with its head exposed on one side, emitting very little light. Is this the only lighting in our entire large room (dining room)? The newly returned Chinese found that she could not see anything, and it was nothing like the light of a Roman electric chandelier. She suddenly felt very ashamed. This is the ancient lighting of my motherland. No matter how bright it is, I will still love it.

;

;I don’t remember how I fell asleep on the first night in Geleshan. I just remember that I insisted on going to school right away, learning my mother tongue again, and becoming a Chinese primary school students. I didn't expect that I was sent to the first grade to learn how to speak Chinese when I expected to continue studying in the fourth grade of elementary school. I went to school happily. I still remember the first class saying "Come, come, come to school, everyone come to school." All Chinese characters did not have any phonetic symbols - we went directly to understand the ancient Chinese characters. On the way home, my classmates chased me and threw stones, shouting "foreign woman!"

;

;My hair is not black and straight. It is brown and curved. When I got home, I scrubbed hard with water and a brush, trying to get it straight and black. No matter how wet it is or how you brush it, it will curl up again as soon as it dries. I had no choice but to face these classmates myself, fight with them, and beat them to the ground one by one. After all, I am already eight years old, a little taller than my first grade classmates. Xiaohu, who never behaved negatively when getting along with his Italian classmates, began to release an inner energy and felt very proud. It turns out that the children of the motherland during the war used physical strength to persuade each other. Well, start learning to speak Chinese and start becoming a Chinese hero.

;——;Get down from the tree, Hutouer .  ;Grandma said.

;

;——;I will not come down from the tree. This tree is my home. ;I answered happily and mischievously.

;

;——;Grandma asked you to get down from that tree immediately . ;

;

;——;No, grandma, I’ll sit down at my place. I see the world from here. ;

;

;——;Hutou'er, you are right away Get down from that tree. Grandma tells you to come down from that dirty tree. ;

;

;——;No. ;

;

;——;We will not be unfilial now Come on, little tiger, good boy, come to grandma. ;

;

;——;Why don’t I leave my own Tree? Why do I have to go to grandma's place? I like living in this tree. Here I can count the enemy planes flying above! ;

;

;At that time, I already spoke Chinese well. On the pine tree near the dark mud house in Geleshan, I remembered I remembered the free big fig tree that no one had observed or searched for in the large garden of the elegant embassy residence in Rome. My bedroom in Rome had a very high ceiling, and the ceiling to the walls were covered with colorful frescoes of classical mythological characters... There was a two- or three-story dollhouse in the bedroom, and I could play with the furniture inside, a doll's bed and cabinets, chairs and tables. , and several puppet dolls that can sit and stand. None of this means anything to me. After my nap, I would sneak outside into the garden, find the tallest fig tree, climb up, and hide among its rich leaves that oozed milky white liquid. No one could see me, and no one would come there to find me.

;

;During the fall months I get to pick the juicy fruits from this huge tree. Even if there are no fruits, I can sit on its big branches and enjoy the breeze, the height and the blissful solitude. For a child with a family nanny, this is a rare blessing.

;

;My lovely little sister Xiaoyu is three and a half years younger than me. She has been in the doting arms of a French-Swiss nanny we call Mademoiselle. The Roman years between the ages of 4 and 8 were very free and devoted more to exploring unknown solitude rather than chatting with servants or dolls. In the ever-changing world of trees with cool breezes passing through, I would listen to the sounds of people talking on the ground from a higher vantage point and feel the movements of adults. That perspective allowed me to interact with adults from a wonderful distance. The world is separated by a buffer zone.

;

;On those generous branches, everything loses the persuasiveness of "adults say". From an arboreal perspective, everything happening on the ground becomes less urgent and threatening. Observing them from a higher perspective than adults reveals that adults often undermine the bounds of worldly wisdom or common sense. Surprisingly, they are often like this, spending a lot of time engaging in unnecessary words and deeds; making many unnecessary actions, untrue behaviors, and developing a hypocritical mentality. Adults spend days and nights thinking about issues that may seem unimportant or even ridiculous to us (children).

;

;For example, they created clothes that were very difficult to put on. My mom's outfit for going out had a long row of buttons - but they were all in the back! Walking behind her, I could see that one of the buttons wasn't buttoned correctly, tilting her head to the side, causing all the other buttons to be wrong, creating a funny-looking sight. The adults would pretend not to notice but would giggle behind her back all day long. No one pointed this out to her, and no one helped her rebutton the row of buttons properly. I could only walk behind and look at them, thinking how stupidly and needlessly all this time was being spent, yet we kids were not allowed to point it out, giggle or laugh; Left to themselves and chalked up to adults' love of spending time talking nonsense, children suffer in silence.

;

;

;——;Why, grandma? Why should I leave my beloved habitat? ;

;

;

;The thought of sitting in a closed room, holding a thin needle, pricking a piece of cotton stretched in a hoop, in and out Being outside, cutting off all the sounds of the breeze, the fresh air from the sun, the songs of birds, or the voices of people, was to me like cutting off life itself.

;In addition to sitting on the pine tree at home, I also like to sit on a small square stone under another pine tree. On my way home from school, I passed through the valley. ;

;This was at the start of World War II, and Japan was mercilessly bombing Chongqing on a daily basis in hopes of wiping out important government targets. But Chongqing has been in haze, with dark clouds, making it difficult for Japanese aircraft to bomb their targets. Every few days we'd hear sirens whining overhead, and everyone, even those of us on the Gele Mountains, would rush out and squeeze into those dank, dark air-raid caves dripping with condensation. water vapor. Every time I would sneak out alone, sit on the rock under my favorite tall pine tree, count the enemy planes, and try to identify the different brands of the planes based on the black and white photos - those photos were taken from the police station by my classmates and I. Got it.

;

;——;Stop everything now, Hutouer, Come to me immediately. Come and learn embroidery, start today. ;

;

;——;Why? What good was embroidery when the Japanese were bombing us with planes overhead? ;

;

;——;Because you will get married, You have to get ready to be a bride! ;

;

;——;That’s terrible, grandma! Is this really the case? ;

;

;——;Of course, fool. Of course you want to get married! Get married and have kids! ;

;

;——;Grandma, please tell me, Is our childhood life also about getting married and having children? ——That is such a painful life, grandma! Each of you has given birth to a baby! Mom and Dad have done it too! Grandma’s baby’s baby has been born and is standing in front of Grandma! Now that our group of children has finally arrived, we must start living interesting lives. We are here to live our special, child-only lives! ;

;

;I suddenly became crystal clear. The reason we are born is to be born! Become the children of our parents in marriage. Now that we are finally born, our purpose of growing up has been fulfilled and we no longer need to get married and have children! The life Grandma explained was completely unacceptable to my broad, arboreal way of thinking. Is this really the life everyone talks about? So it seems like adults are completely ignorant! The real purpose of life cannot be just for human existence. I saw clearly at that time that humans have obviously not asked this question. The meaning of existence - why we live - this is the question! What did we come to this fun place for? Of course I am here to appreciate this life and play with it thoroughly.

;

;Play it to the end - this is what we are here for - isn't it? This most basic and important test has taken root in my heart since then.

;

;Grandma told me many stories. There was a large, round metal barrel on a high shelf in her room. Grandma swayed her little feet back and forth, and was able to walk to the elevated shelf, take down the particularly bright bucket, mix it up, open it, and take out the maltose she made. There is nothing in the world that tastes better than the maltose rolled by grandma herself. They are round and flat, with white powder on the outside to prevent them from sticking together and being difficult to separate. Therefore, eating maltose can certainly be considered one of the main goals of life.

;

;Listening to grandma telling stories is also one of the wonderful purposes, so charming! Grandma’s stories always include our family’s great heroes. For example, my grandma’s surname is Xia, and the Xia family comes from Yue Fei’s hometown. Grandma's voice was as sweet as honey and as high as a bird, and the stories she slowly told in her Xuzhou accent were all delicious. Xiaohu sat next to Grandma's knees and listened, forgetting everything else. The whole village loved Yue Fei, who helped the emperor return from the Jin Kingdom to restore the emperor's throne. However, Gaozong was unwilling to return the throne he had already occupied to his father. This unfilial son called Yue Fei and Yue Fei's eldest son. , was convicted as a national enemy and beheaded. The little tiger would burst into tears when he heard this, with tears and snot flying everywhere. The villagers who loved Yue Fei were too sad to speak.

;

;Grandma also likes to tell the story of grandpa’s trip to Mongolia——

;

;;Tiger Head, one day, the country wanted the Mongols to stay in China and not be able to leave the motherland and go out independently, so they invited your grandfather to persuade them. So your grandfather, General Xu at that time, ran to Mongolia alone without any troops or weapons, taking only his flute master and the old lady from Xuzhou who made pancakes with him. ;

;

;;In this way, the three of them arrived in Mongolia , found a small hill, went to the top and sat down. Grandpa planted his big "Xu" military flag on the ground and sat there writing lyrics, singing songs, admiring the moon, eating pancakes, and calmly waiting for the Mongolian chief to appear and surrender. ;

;

;;After a while, the Mongolian chieftain really coming. He looked up and wow! I heard the sound of Kun Opera. I was shocked when I saw the big military flag with the word "Xu" in it. I immediately climbed up respectfully. As soon as I saw my grandfather, I knelt down and kowtowed desperately to apologize. "Oops! The president has come in person. I am so ignorant and incompetent that I dare not take it! I have no intention of disturbing the uncle!" He regretted that it was too late to kowtow and apologize. The confused chief thought that your grandfather was Mr. Xu Shichang, our president at the time, so he surrendered directly. . Hahaha! You see, grandpa brought Mongolia back without saying a word. You say how capable your grandpa is. ;

;

;This is how my grandma narrated the story of the three grandfathers taking back Mongolia, and it has become one of our private family history jokes. Now when the great-grandchildren scattered in various countries gather together, they will perform multiple versions of this story as a "historical drama", showing the story of General Xu Shuzheng's recovery of Outer Mongolia from various angles.

;

;Of course Dad has never heard grandma say this. In front of dad, no one dared to mention grandpa's name or past events. Dad would shed tears just thinking about his beloved father. Xiaohu actually liked hearing grandma's story very much, it was much more enjoyable than Yue Fei's story. I laughed every time I heard the part where the chief was covered in sweat and had no time to kowtow and surrender.

;

;At this time, various ideals of country, struggle, self-sacrifice, integrity, and serving the public took root in my heart. I began to think repeatedly about the purpose of our existence; I felt how important it is and how vast the world of time and space is. But in the deepest part of my heart, I began to have an overwhelming doubt...

;On the afternoon of October 20, 2023, the "Chengdu Marathon & World Science Fiction Conference City Walk" flash mob event was held at the World Science Fiction Conference The main venue of the conference was held on the greenway around the lake. (Chengdu Business Daily/Visual China/Photo)

;

;The 5-day 81st World Science Fiction Convention was held in a city that has not changed its name for more than 2,000 years - —Chengdu;——; has come to an end. This is the first time that China has held such a science fiction event. In October 2023, more than 20,000 science fiction fans and more than 1,200 guests from 35 countries and regions around the world gathered in Chengdu to talk about the future in this modern city with a long history. Imagine.

;

;During the conference, 27-year-old science fiction writer Bai Ben stayed in a hotel in Pidu District. On the 19th floor of the hotel, through the window, he saw a shopping mall not far away, which happened to be the one he participated in the design and construction of when he was a real estate company at his former employer.

;

;Bai Bi could not describe his feelings for a moment: it was a sense of time and space intertwined in Chengdu, where the past and present, ideals and reality merged. He just came to Chengdu in 2021 and worked as a designer in a real estate company. After 9 months, he was too busy to ;home;; but it was also in Chengdu that he got closer and closer to his science fiction dream, and he successively won several projects in China The Science Fiction Galaxy Award for Best Newcomer and the Chinese Science Fiction Nebula Award for Best Short Story Silver Award. Now, he also has his own book signings at science fiction conventions.

;

;As one of the millions of young people "floating in Chengdu", Bai Bi from Jiangsu has a reason to stay in Chengdu. At present, he is mainly engaged in the Internet industry and works part-time in science fiction writing. There are few cities that can simultaneously host good Internet companies, embrace the vision of building a science fiction industry, and also create a comfortable, livable and smoky urban atmosphere.

;

;Chengdu attracts Bai Ben, and young people like Bai Ben also attract Chengdu. For years, this rapidly rising megacity in the Midwest has struggled to recruit and retain young talents. I don’t know who was the first to say the words, “After Chengdu, there will be no more wandering.” This has become the essence of Chengdu’s talent work branding and the pursuit of the city’s builders.

;

;"Beside Xinglong Lake, look up and meet the doctor"

;

;After five years, I faced the computer screen with a picture of Aba, Sichuan Province in 2018 Huang Ying is still quite moved by the high-altitude aerial view of Aerzhai, Wenchuan County, Prefecture. That year, a landslide suddenly hit Aerzhai. Half of the village collapsed ; and half of it was buried. Fortunately, no one died. The geological disaster monitoring and early warning platform developed by Sichuan Zhongke Chuanxin Technology Co., Ltd. played a role. Villagers moved in advance and escaped this natural disaster.

;

;Huang Ying is now the deputy general manager of this company. However, going back to 6 years ago, Huang Ying was still confused on the eve of changing careers. At that time, the 24-year-old was working in a survey and design institute in a province in Central and South China. The industry was gradually declining. A colleague asked: "Should we transform into high technology?"

;

;Huang Ying is somewhat tempted, but where to settle is a problem. He thought of Chengdu, where he spent four years in college.

;

;In recent years, major cities across the country have increased their efforts to attract young talents. Chengdu also needs more young people to participate in urban development and construction. Li Rong, a talent worker in Chengdu, told Southern Weekend reporters that Chengdu has launched version 1.0 of its new talent policy around the idea of ​​“gathering people to prosper the city”.

;

;"Settlement first and then employment" is a policy initiative that has led to a nationwide trend of settling down and attracting talents. "Those under 45 years old and with a bachelor's degree or above can directly settle in Chengdu with their graduation certificate." Li Rong said that in the past six years, Chengdu has attracted more than 710,000 college students to settle down.

;

;Huang Ying took a fancy to the convenience of settling down and joined the trend of "Peacock Flying Southwest". He and his partners founded a company in Chengdu High-tech Zone, focusing on geological disasters and Environmental disaster prevention and reduction platform construction and product research and development.

;

;Everything is difficult at the beginning. Huang Ying's new company encountered obstacles in financing, human resources, sales and other aspects. Initially, he traveled to almost every county in western and southern Sichuan to introduce himself to the local land and resources departments.

;

;Chengdu gave him a hand. Huang Ying remembers that when the company first settled in Chengdu High-tech Zone, the government provided policy support of halving office rents. At the end of 2017, the company sold the first batch of prototypes to a county in western Sichuan. Half a year later, the machine successfully warned of landslides twice, and since then it has gradually opened up the market in southwest China. However, government assistance has not stopped. Three years after the epidemic, the company has also received financial subsidies.

;

;Huang Ying said that currently, the company has applied its equipment and platforms to water conservancy dams, mine safety, foundation pit support, transportation, etc., and has Go nationwide.

;

;Huang Ying’s career is developing, and Chengdu’s talent policy is also iterating. In 2020, Chengdu launched the New Talent Policy Version 2.0 around the construction of the Western Science City, focused on technological innovation, launched and implemented Tianfu Laboratory's global high-end talent recruitment plan, created Chengdu's characteristic professional group, and supported high-level platforms to open to the society. In 2022, The Chengdu Innovation Index ranks 29th in the world.

;

;Three years have passed, and there are many scientific research institutions in the Chengdu Science City located in Tianfu New District, Sichuan. Liu Hongyan, a 34-year-old assistant researcher at the Institute of Urban Agriculture, Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences, joked, “If you walk around Xinglong Lake, you might just look up and meet a doctor.” In 2019, she came to the institute as a postdoctoral fellow to work on functional Food development and other work, becoming a member of Xinglong Lakeside's army of doctors.

;

;Shi Jian, the 36-year-old assistant director of the DC Research Institute of Tsinghua Sichuan Energy Internet Research Institute, is also a Ph.D. from Xinglong Lakeside. Looking back on his two years in Chengdu, he felt that he had achieved what he had hoped for.

;

;Shi Jian is pursuing the transformation of scientific and technological achievements. He once worked for 7 years in a research institute affiliated to a state-owned enterprise in a southeastern province, focusing on research on ultra-high voltage DC engineering and new energy power generation. He has always been troubled by the fact that the cycle of transferring scientific research to application is too long. After arriving in Tianfu New District, Sichuan, he was able to flex his muscles. Right now, the Shijian team is developing the most critical projects in the power industry such as series of power equipment and power chips for DC projects.

;

;;

;

;October 2023 On the 22nd, Peking University Qiu Deba Gymnasium, the scene of the "Rongpiao Talent Gathering" Peking University special event. (Talent Office of Chengdu Municipal Party Committee/Picture)

;

;Why did the six million "Rong Piao" come

;

;At the end of October 2023, a group of students from Tsinghua University At a job fair, a doctor of medicine expressed mutual interest in a state-owned enterprise in Wenjiang District, Chengdu. State-owned enterprises do not "go round and round to make appointments". Instead, the person in charge directly reads the resume, interviews, and talks about job content, remuneration and benefits.

;

;This is a scene from the Beijing special event of the "Rongpiao Talent Gathering" series of events. Li Rong introduced that as the most important series of talent recruitment activities in Chengdu in recent years, the "Rongpiao Talent Gathering" has held more than 1,000 talent recruitment activities in key cities at home and abroad, and signed more than 200,000 contracts.

;

;In recent years, Chengdu has focused on leading the city’s talent work with branding strategies.  The slogan "Rongpiao" has been shouted out, but there has been some controversy in society as to whether the talent brand should continue to use this name. After all, like Beipiao and Shanghai Piao, there is still the word "piao".

;

;However, Chengdu has been a typical immigrant city since ancient times, with cultural characteristics of openness, tolerance, generosity and friendliness. According to talent workers in Chengdu, the genetic inheritance and cultural core of "Rongpiao" have long been rooted in the urban development trajectory, and have become Chengdu's endless driving force, changing the original meaning of "piao" and enriching the meaning of "piao". "Connotation. Chengdu respects every individual's dream, cherishes every upward force, and uses the greatest sincerity to help "Rongpiao" realize their personal value.

;

;Chengdu has fully launched the practice of talent work branding strategy, creating a deeply rooted "Rongpiao" brand, and is also the first country in the country to apply for trademark registration The city's talent work brand has created a series of flagship products and a series of derivatives, such as the "Rongpiao Plan" to attract talents, the "Rongpiao Talent Gathering" to recruit talents, the "Rongpiao Cup" to gather talents, and the "Rongpiao Cup" to educate talents. Talent Development Institute”, Jingcai’s “Rongpiao Talent Day”, Licai’s “Rongcheng Talent Green Card”, etc.

;

;Chengdu has been exploring ways to solve practical difficulties for young college students who have just entered society. "Thinking about it from a talent perspective, what does a newly graduated college student lack when going to a city to find a job? It must be a place to live." Li Rong said that based on this idea, Chengdu has created 26 "Rongpiao" cities in recent years. "Youth Talent Station" provides short-term free accommodation for fresh graduates who come to Chengdu to find jobs, as well as a series of value-added services such as employment guidance and urban integration. "As long as they hold the interview notice and pass the online application, young college students can stay in the apartment for free for up to one month." So far, more than 80,000 young college students have been accommodated.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters learned that in the past, when enterprises and institutions in Chengdu went to first-tier cities and well-known universities to recruit, the results were not good because they worked alone and lacked visibility. not good. Later, they changed their approach and maximized the effectiveness of talent introduction by building a collaborative talent introduction model of "government guidance, employer leadership, and broad social participation" to unify publicity themes, unified promotion processes, and unified logos and slogans.

;

;Taking this year's "Rongpiao Talent Gathering" Tsinghua University and Peking University as an example, Chengdu mobilized 26 public institutions and 16 municipal state-owned enterprises to come up with For high-quality positions, university research institutes and Fortune 500 companies are invited to participate in recruitment. According to statistics, this event released 782 recruitment positions and attracted more than 1,800 young college students to participate. The activity includes city promotion, opportunity list release, job promotion, doctoral and postdoctoral policy promotion, etc. Each recruitment unit "can add their own creativity" and set up stalls to recruit talents.

;

;Recruiting young talents is only the first step. In order to retain talents, Chengdu also spent real money. From the city level to the district (city) and county level, there are a series of talent project applications and talent level assessments. Liu Hongyan recalled that after she achieved certain scientific research results, she was evaluated as a senior talent category C in the "Tianfu Talent Plan" of Sichuan Tianfu New District in 2022. The new district will provide a subsidy of 500,000 yuan within five years. The following year, she applied for scientific research funds from the Chengdu Agricultural Science and Technology Talent Cultivation Program.

;

;Right now, a laboratory in the institute is filled with freeze-dried fruit and vegetable solid drinks developed by Liu Hongyan’s team, and a whitening and moisturizing set containing phloretin. and other technological transformation achievements. This Inner Mongolian native has bought a house and settled in Chengdu. "Currently, Chengdu is the city that best coordinates my work and life."

;

;The "Chengdu Youth Development Report (2022)" released by the Chengdu Municipal Committee of the Communist Youth League and the Chengdu New Economic Development Research Institute shows that the population of "Rongpiao" reaches 6.8349 million. Among them, the proportion of young people from outside Sichuan Province is 21.85%, and the proportion of young people from "Rongpiao" who come from outside the province is 32.9%.

;

;;

;

;Rongpiao Youth Talent Station, Jinjiang District, Chengdu City. (Chengdu Municipal Party Committee Talent Office/Photo)

;

;Camping in the city, looking at the snow-capped mountains on the rooftop

;

;There is little research in Hu Peng’s life dictionary Such lofty words as institute and laboratory. He is just an ordinary person who loves life. In Chengdu, he felt another attraction of this city for him.

;

;30-year-old Hu Peng is from Leshan, Sichuan. He works as a tour guide in Chengdu, taking tourists to appreciate the different flavors of the city, including city gates, city walls, streets, and museums. , listen to historical stories and observe the lifestyle of local residents.

;

;He developed two niche routes, one from Shaocheng in the west of the city to Fuqin, and the other from Xiner Village in the north of the city to Caojia Lane. In Fuqin, he had seen a cup of tea costing 3 yuan, and a bowl of noodles costing 89 yuan. The old man went out to eat noodles and drink tea in the morning, and sat there all day, feeling relaxed and happy. In Xiner Village, "the size of the community is the size of the market." The market men and women lingered in the market in the morning, and he felt a vibrant beauty.

;

;Young people can always find the livable side of Chengdu. Science fiction writer Huo Zhongwu came to Chengdu in 2005 to study at university and settled here after graduation. He enjoys the pleasant cost of living here. Similarly, renting an apartment near the city center is about a quarter of that in Shanghai. A "Rongpiao" young man admitted to Southern Weekend reporters that one of the important reasons why he came to Chengdu to work three years ago was that Chengdu's housing prices are extremely cost-effective among provincial capital cities.

;

;"Have fun" is a business card of Chengdu. Huo Zhongwu’s observation is that life in Chengdu is much slower than in first-tier cities, and there are always people in the teahouses and cafes on the roadside.

;

;Bai Ben was deeply impressed by a salon at the World Science Fiction Convention. A writer mentioned that he had seen a netizen post asking: It will be rare to have sunny weather in Chengdu tomorrow. Does anyone want to go to a high-rise building to watch the snow-capped mountains together? The writer went to the roof before dawn the next day, and there were already many people rubbing their hands and waiting. “This kind of thing is hard to imagine in other cities,” Bai Ben said.

;

;Chengdu has also captured the needs of talents for urban environment and quality of life. In 2022, Chengdu will launch the "Talent New Deal 3.0" version with excellent platforms and ecological management, attracting more young talents to take the initiative.

;

;"When the water accumulates, fish gather;, and when trees grow thicker, birds gather." The relevant person in charge of the Talent Office of Chengdu Municipal Party Committee introduced that Chengdu has been We strive to protect the value attribution of talents with the highest quality services and create a value ecosystem where everyone is seen, respected and cared for. What can be proved is that Chengdu has been ranked first in "China's happiest city" for 14 consecutive years, ranked first in "Fortune" magazine's "Attractive Cities for College Students and Young Job Seekers", and won "China's Best Talent Attracting City" for 4 consecutive years. "prize.

;

;"Talent work is ultimately inseparable from improving the quality of the city." For example, in order to cater to young people's fun-loving and quality-of-life mentality, Chengdu continues to optimize its environment , a 100-kilometer first-level greenway of the Ring Ecological Park has been built inside and outside the city ring expressway, with billowing green wheat fields, lush grassland, and swaying woods; while building a park city, Chengdu has opened up a large number of wetlands and green spaces As a camping site, "everyone goes camping and basking in the sun on weekends", creating a new picture of urban life.

;

;;

;

;9, 2023 On March 3, Chengdu’s famous internet celebrity check-in place was a unique “underwater bookstore” next to Xinglong Lake. (Visual China/Picture)

;

;Resonance among young people

;

;Chengdu’s life scene that attracts young people also includes abundant public spaces.

;

;The streets and alleys here hide ;three;;thousand; more than one bookstore, far more than any other city in the country. It is difficult to count the number of public activities that are closely connected to it - reading clubs, movie viewing parties, script screenings, and sharing by scholars and experts. Some active spaces can host hundreds of events a year. The event was small in scale, with only twenty or thirty people at most, but it provided an opportunity for connection and resonance for countless young people eager to express, share, and see.

;

;Around 2015, Wang Miaomiao worked as an account manager for a brand company in Chengdu. At that time, she fell into depression for a time due to family reasons. She began to participate in a large number of offline public activities and spent three or four nights a week in various sharing sessions. Although most of the time, she couldn't understand what the sharer was saying, she liked the friendly and warm atmosphere, which allowed her to temporarily escape the pain in her life.

;

;Product manager Di Hao came to Chengdu to work in 2016. At the beginning, he couldn't find anyone he could play with, whether at work or in life. A year later, he saw the activities of the Toastmasters Club in the same city on Douban and tried to participate. Since then, he has been hooked.

;

;He has vivid memories of many activities. During the reading party, they read Tolstoy to understand human greed; after the movie viewing party, someone explained Plato's Allegory of the Cave. Once, scholar Wang Di came to a tavern in the suburbs of Chengdu to share. More than a hundred people came and ;Wang Di; talked until midnight.

;

;Di Hao felt that the young friends who participated in the event gave him a sense of belonging. These activities also opened up a new world for Di Hao. In the past, when facing big figures, he had a sense of order based on distinction between superiority and inferiority. The egalitarian atmosphere of public activities gradually made him accustomed to dealing with others as an equal.

;

;After 2018, Hu Peng also often went to Chengdu to participate in public events. In his early years, he met a Polish man and a British man at a sharing meeting. They worked for a few months a year, teaching English and doing project planning, and the rest of the time was spent traveling around. This way of life surprised him.

;

;Hu Peng prides himself on being a young man from a small town, having graduated with a bachelor's degree. Many people in his hometown have nothing to do in their spare time except playing cards. These activities made him realize that there was another possibility in life.

;

;Also in 2018, Wang Miaomiao, who has participated in numerous public activities, became the director of Xunlu Library. This is a community library, but it aspires to become a "humanistic beacon". Wang Miaomiao discovered that people lacked general education, so he invited professors from Sichuan University to come to the library to teach general education courses about Du Fu and visual culture. She listened to lawyer Zhang Ying's "Bright Dialogue" series of public debates and thought it was good, and invited Zhang Ying to the library for a discussion on psychology. Some participants said that these discussions responded to the rising enthusiasm for psychology since the epidemic.

;

;Wang Miaomiao feels that these public lives have reshaped her life. She likes to study people and society, and is curious about where strong vitality is born, and the sharers ;also; responded to her questions in their own ways.

;

;In 2023, she will become busier. Offline activities in Chengdu are very prosperous. In addition to creating more in-depth public activity content, she also needs to run a "reclamation community" that unites participants with reading as the core.

;

;In this corner of the southwest, public space is so prosperous, and Hu Peng connects it with the characteristics of the city. Chengdu has a tradition of chatting in teahouses and cafes. In addition, perhaps many busy young people are heading to first-tier cities such as Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou. The young people who come to Chengdu are more pursuing spiritual enrichment and yearning for a better life. They find resonance in Chengdu and at the same time inject new vitality into Chengdu's public life. People and cities always choose and nourish each other.

;

;(Li Rong and Di Hao are pseudonyms, Bai Ben and Huo Zhongwu are pen names)
