;During the National Day, people ride on the greenway around the city on the central axis of Chengdu. Visual China

;

;Ji Ying will appear at the Jinsha Heritage Museum every Thursday morning. She is a volunteer guide here. Usually, after gathering seven or eight tourists, the team sets off. Along the way, there will be more and more listeners behind the red volunteer uniforms.

;

;This 51-year-old Chengdu native was originally a manager of a foreign company. He traveled around the southwest and was busy and exhausted from work. After a serious illness, the doctor warned "not to be too tired from now on", so the museum at home became a new choice. The company organized groups to come and listen to it several times. They were surprised by the colleague in front of them who talked about the ancient Shu civilization.

;

;There are more than 3.6 million people like her with dual identities in Chengdu. Zhang Zimeng, a student at Sichuan Conservatory of Music, is a volunteer in the "Song is the Sweetest Medicine" project. She goes to the hospital every week to serve as a vocal teacher for fifty or sixty "Teletubbies" suffering from severe spinal deformity; 37-year-old Express Member Tang Jian is the captain of the "Maverick Pioneer Drivers" volunteer service team. His team is a "mobile probe" that walks through the streets.

;

;These are volunteer service stories that happen every day in every corner of Chengdu. Wei Na, the relevant person in charge of the Volunteer Service Department of the Propaganda Department of the Chengdu Municipal Party Committee, told Southern Weekend reporters that they have built a volunteer service platform "Civilized Xingrong" to use information technology to record all volunteer service information. Since the entire platform is in operation, there are nearly 40,000 registered volunteer teams in the city.

;

;Chengdu is becoming a model city of "City of Volunteers". Wei Na feels that this is a "process of gathering glimmers of light": "Looking at them separately, they are all small and microscopic, but together they are dedicated to the governance of the city and its happiness."

;

;“It’s so troublesome to be a volunteer”

;

;This is Ji Ying’s sixth year as a volunteer at the Jinsha Heritage Museum. “Without a strong belief, there is no way to persevere.”

;

;There are more than 60 volunteers in the museum, and the recruitment assessment of Ji Ying’s explanation team is recognized as strict. This "novice on historical knowledge" stumbled all the way. He passed the group interview, completed the first round of the relics museum's interpretation test, passed the written test, and passed the entire museum's interpretation interview, becoming a trainee volunteer. The entire assessment process lasted nearly seven months.

;

;The first lesson of the volunteer training is to visit the museum, and the second lesson is to learn the team rules and regulations. The service hours are required to reach 120 hours per year, and in principle, they must come once a week. Ma Nong, a volunteer in the service group, was not used to it when he first arrived: "I didn't expect that being a volunteer would be so troublesome, but it is so strict."

;

;
;

;

;;

;

;Volunteers in red uniforms are explaining to tourists at the Jinsha Site Museum. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Gao Yichen

;

;The person who manages this volunteer team is Lu Lu, a staff member of the museum’s Department of Public Service and Social Education. "We often call her King Lu or Little Leather Whip." Manong joked, "King Lu" is very strict. If you don't bring a work permit, you won't be allowed in, and the service time will not be counted. As time went by, she discovered that this strict compliance with the rules was equivalent to blocking out "those who were not determined", leaving only those who really wanted to be volunteers.

;

;Lu Lu told Southern Weekend reporters that she "stated the rules and regulations upfront" in the hope of conducting a double selection with volunteers. "Without management, there is no cohesion. If you can accept it, we will happily work together."

;

;The cohesion of the team is not only reflected in the system. Lu Lu will try her best to remember each volunteer’s birthday and lead everyone in the group to send blessings. At the end-of-year commendation meeting, she will contact the departments the volunteers have worked with and request them to issue certificates of honor to express respect and gratitude to the volunteers. "Volunteer partners are not here for material things, so I hope to satisfy them in other ways that they are respected and needed."

;

;For museums with limited manpower, volunteers are important supplementary strength. Lu Lu mentioned that the museum has more than 30 docents, and during winter and summer vacations and popular holidays, the supply far exceeds demand, and volunteers can fill the seats. They announced the designated time for volunteers to give lectures, three in the morning and one in the afternoon, "which can alleviate the demand to a great extent."

;

;The English translation volunteers in the translation team have a "full schedule" of work. The museum had tried a translation company, but it involved archaeological terminology and was more difficult. Instead, the museum's volunteer translation team was more competent - they had all passed CET-8 in English, and their academic qualifications were basically at least a master's degree. "We have a lot of professional training, including the curator who will explain to us the excavation and historical origin of cultural relics, and we all understand them very clearly," said Lei Lei, the head of the translation team.

;

;Overall scheduling from city to district

;

;On the aforementioned "Civilized Rong" platform, there are an average of more than 500 various activities like this every day.

;

;This is the first intelligent platform in the country to fully support the practice of civilization and the development of volunteer service activities in the new era. It is understood that this smart platform can realize the complete record of volunteer service information. At the same time, it is also an important reference for award evaluation.

;

;Liu Yi, deputy editor-in-chief of the Chengdu Volunteer Network, who is responsible for managing the platform, said that volunteer service activities in all districts and counties in Chengdu can be seen on the platform. “Its biggest function is to facilitate citizens to find activities and sign up to participate. ".

;

;Recently, there have been particularly many ecological and environmental protection activities on the platform. Liu Yi told Southern Weekend reporters that during the National Day holiday, the Chengdu Municipal Civilization Office linked 14 volunteer service stations on the greenway around the city to carry out cycling check-in activities. Chengdu’s city-ring greenway is a holy place for cycling enthusiasts, with a total length of 100 kilometers. "The needs of citizens prompted us to extend civilized practices and volunteer services to the greenway scene."

;

;The 14 stations cooperate with each other and each has its own actions. Zhang Ying, chief of the Creation and Volunteer Service Section of the Propaganda Department of the Wenjiang District Party Committee, recalled to Southern Weekend reporters that at that time, she was most worried about not attracting citizens to stop. The organizer put together the civilized blind box of the station into a map of China. Cyclists passing by would always stop and ask questions, which was very eye-catching. “Every day, our check-in points are crowded with people.”

;

;Different from the projects in the Jinsha Site Museum, this is a network of volunteer activities woven by government departments at all levels in Chengdu. An event lasting several days requires the cooperation of multiple departments. In the greenway station activities, civilized units at all levels play the main role, guiding and coordinating social organizations to participate in the assistance, and civilized units at the provincial, municipal, and district levels pair up to jointly build greenways. In the Wenjiang section of the Ring Greenway alone, the participating departments include the Wenjiang District Health Bureau, the District Culture, Sports and Tourism Bureau, and the District Education Bureau, with a total of more than 100 people from at least 12 units and enterprises.

;

;The specific activities of the greenway station every day are also carried out by the responsible unit. Zhang Ying gave an example. The district health bureau is responsible for free TCM clinics, which provide health consultation services to citizens, teach first aid knowledge, and deal with sudden accidents such as cycling injuries and hiking sprains. The Wenjiang District Traditional Chinese Medicine Hospital also dispatched medical team volunteers. .

;

;For Zhang Ying, it is not difficult to connect various departments to participate in volunteer activities. The entire event is coordinated by the New Era Civilization Practice Center, and the district party secretary serves as the director of the center to implement the work. Before the start of a large-scale event, the Civilized Practice Center will hold a scheduling meeting, and all departments that need to cooperate with the event must attend the meeting.

;

;According to her, Wenjiang District is among the first batch of new era civilized practice center pilot projects in the province and the second batch in the country. A district-level center, nine towns and sub-districts, and 95 villages and communities have jointly built a three-level position where the Civilized Practice Center is located. It also has 8 professional volunteer service standing teams and multiple special volunteer service teams. “When we need it When the time comes, we can coordinate.”

;

;“Our volunteer service model in Chengdu is well coordinated from top to bottom. The civilized practice centers in each district and county have standardized systems, activities and organizational structures, which can promote this kind of service very well. Civilized practices and volunteer service activities are carried out on a regular basis." Zhang Ying concluded.

;Volunteer service in "Taobao Mall"

;

;Establishing a points feedback incentive mechanism is an important part of building a city of volunteers.

;

;Volunteer time exchange for points and services, and related selection and recognition are common options for each project, and it is a top-down design. The "Chengdu Volunteer Service Incentive Measures (Trial)" launched by Chengdu City in 2019 is the country's first systematic volunteer service incentive system.

;

;Initially, the framers wanted to link education, employment, settlement, etc. with volunteer services. Wei Na admitted that there are difficulties at the practical level, such as extra points for employment interviews or public examinations. Due to the lack of upper-level system support, it is difficult to clearly correlate volunteer service experience with the degree of extra points, and the basis is also difficult to quantify.

;

;However, there are some areas where quantitative bonus points can be gained. For example, in the residence permit point statistics, volunteer service is worth 10 points. "The previous policy was to add 100 points to get a household registration, and to participate in volunteer services, you can add 10 points. The points are still very impressive." She added that the Municipal Civilization Office has a dedicated person responsible for the points recognition of volunteer services, which has been changed to Normal operation.

;

;In addition, volunteer service is closely related to the comprehensive quality evaluation of primary and secondary school students in Chengdu. If you participate in the "Civilized Rong" volunteer project, the platform will automatically generate an official certificate, which will be used as a reference for school evaluation.

;

;On the "Civilized Xingrong" platform, volunteers can exchange points for corresponding rights and interests. Liu Yi nicknamed it the "Taobao" of volunteer service. The online points mall can be redeemed for items, training and services. Some communities will also upload incentive items, such as a pack of washing powder, a bag of rice, or a haircut card at the doorstep. "We are actually using the concept of crowdfunding to provide courtesy and help for volunteer services."

;

;Niushikou Street, which gave birth to the "Maverick Pioneer Drivers" volunteer service team, has created its own points incentive system.

;

;Liu Jie, a staff member of the Party and Mass Affairs Office of Niushikou Street, said that one point is equal to one yuan, which can be exchanged for mobile phone holders, ponchos, power banks and other items in the points mall, or you can choose coupons donated by caring companies. . The most popular redemption items are Hongqi supermarket chain cash coupons, which can be used directly for consumption.

;

;For the volunteers of Jinsha Heritage Museum, the biggest incentive to give back is intangible. The suggestions they put forward always received support from the museum: inviting sanitation workers into the museum, accompanying nearly a hundred visually impaired friends to visit, and bringing the story of the "Sun Bird" into the community...these ideas that sprouted in practice, It has become a representative project of the museum’s volunteer activities, making the volunteers quite proud.

;

;The audio program "Xiao Zhi Hua Tian Fu" led by Ji Ying was also born under this kind of autonomy. In the program, the "Jinsha Maidens" will use Chengdu dialect to explain the ancient Shu civilization and Tianfu culture in the 31st Universiade. "We hope that through this program, more people will have a deeper understanding of Chengdu."

;

;The seeds planted in 2008

;

;Wei Na found that the soil had become thicker, and volunteering had gradually become a way of life for Chengdu people.

;

;During the National Day holiday in 2023, a staff member of the Volunteer Service took his son to ride on the greenway around the city. When they arrived at the Baiye section of Jiaozi in Wuhou District, they saw that the volunteers were very busy. My 16-year-old son stopped, signed up on the spot, and worked as a volunteer at the inn for two hours.

;

;Her parents have also spontaneously joined the elderly volunteer association in the community. Various volunteer services are often announced in the association group. My father will participate in chorus programs to celebrate festivals for residents; my mother will participate in river patrols every week, walking with friends in the same unit to check whether there are any fishing issues during closed seasons.

;

;More than ten years ago, two old people came to this strange city to help take care of their children. By participating in volunteer service activities in the community, they got to know the elderly people around them and established their own social circle. At present, I have sold my house in my hometown and chose to settle in Chengdu. She smiled and said, "Because they love this city very much, and they are also very active in community activities after settling here. They are really super backbones."

;

;In Wei Na's view, Chengdu people have a strong sense of belonging in their hearts. Philanthropic sentiment: "The year 2008, when the earthquake occurred, can actually be called the first year of volunteer service in Chengdu. We were the place where the disaster occurred, and there were NGOs from all over the world, and many volunteers came to help us.";

;For philanthropist Xu Zhen, the seed of volunteering was planted in 2008. At that time, many rescue teams and volunteers from all over the world poured into Sichuan, and those helping hands left a deep impression on her. Four or five years later, when she was in college, she wanted to join the school's volunteer association.

;

;Today, as the person in charge of the "Song is the Sweetest Medicine" project of Cloud Public Welfare, she has been serving "Teletubbies" with volunteers for nearly seven years. When she first saw these patients with severe spinal deformity, their heads and waists were covered with steel rings, which were connected and fixed by four support rods above their heads. This physical condition gave Xu Zhen a very strong intuition. impact.

;

;Usually, volunteers will take patients to do vocal exercises, exhale to make a rhythm, and make a "hissing" sound on their mouths to exercise their breath. This is a part of the treatment process and is customized by the director of the orthopedics department of the hospital. From admission to discharge, "Teletubbies" will grow an average of 20 centimeters in height and usher in a new life. Xu Zhen was especially pleased when she saw someone in the group changed the note to "discharged".

;

;More volunteer seeds are being planted continuously in the "One Hour a Week" project carried out by the Chengdu Volunteer Network.

;

;Xie Hong, leader of the "One Hour a Week" project team, introduced that they advocate citizens to participate in at least one hour of volunteer service every week. In the four years since the project was launched, there have been more than 170 online and offline activities, more than 80,000 volunteers participated, and more than 5 million people have been served. During the Chengdu Universiade, citizens were encouraged to upload moments of civilized viewing of the games. After the Universiade, a micro-story collection was launched for children.

;

;For her, "one hour per week" is a habit-forming task, so she tries to lower the threshold for volunteer service participation and increase the number of participants and coverage. The "shoot as you go" activity, which is being vigorously promoted, can be participated in anywhere in the city. As long as you take photos of civilized behaviors and upload them five times, you can get electronic certificates, volunteer service hours and points. “The ultimate goal is to inspire our citizens to identify with volunteer services, identify with the friendly atmosphere of the city, and be willing to contribute to the civilization and friendliness of the city.” Liu Yi said.

;

;Micro-governance of “two-way running”

;

;In this city of volunteers, volunteers serve others and are also served. This "two-way rush" is already a kind of urban public governance on a micro level.

;

;On Hongjixin Road in Jinjiang District, a conspicuous courtyard has a sign reading "Brother Xiao Niu·Sha Yi Jie". This is a 24-hour love station and a resting place for new employment groups such as express delivery, takeaway, and online ride-hailing drivers. Gao Linya, the person in charge of the "Little Niu Brother" project, said that there are already 35 sites like this in Jinjiang District. From replenishing water and charging, to psychological consultation, labor safety protection, employment guidance services, vocational skills training, holding free clinics, etc., they are all options at the station.

;

;In the early demand survey, the "Little Niu Brother" team found that what couriers and delivery people needed most was charging services, so they specially coordinated with a company to set up six charging stations at the entrance of the community opposite the post station. Set charging cabinet. "'Brother Maverick' has not only served these groups from the beginning, but also guided them to participate in social services, forming a closed-loop logic of two-way services." Gao Linya said.
